TopicTitle: Successful SSTO Spaceplane Launch & Land. AT LAST!

Articles.Content:
YES! After a long last (and many more spaceplanes tumbling during re-entry).

I've finally succeeded launching a spaceplane into orbit and landing it back to kerbin in once piece.

According to my previous definition, I am now a pro/accomplished KSP player.

For me, a accomplished/professional KSP player is anyone who has successfully launched an ssto spaceplane into orbit and landed it back to kerbin in one piece (not to mention going to other bodies and back).

How about yours?

Use this definition as your guide:

http://i.imgur.com/s7GdFZO.png

PICTURES!

Javascript is disabled. View full album

...yeah I know I'm few years late already but doesn't matter.

And you'll only be like "what?" if you're already a routine spaceplane flyer.

LANDING VIDEO COMING UP!

I'm more impressed that you found flat ground to set down on that wasn't KSC or the old airstrip on the island across from it. I force all my SSTO planes to land at KSC simply because I'm afraid of setting down on rough terrain and snapping the wheels off / exploding. Congrats on getting your flyer orbital!

I've just estimated, finding a piece of land massive enough for the slow descent (so I won't go running out of juice while in the middle of the ocean). And I prefer landing anywhere - I find specific landings that difficult still
